item.title: Skills
item.description:

    • LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, etc.)

Languages #

  • English: Fluent / Professional Working Proficiency
  • German: Basic / Elementary Proficiency

item.title: Experience
item.description:
Data Engineering & Intelligent Automation #

Project 1: High-Accuracy Invoice & Ticket Digitalization Pipeline #

A commercial firm was facing the risk of significant government fines due to errors in their manual data entry process. I created a system that could accurately digitalize their 3,000+ printed invoices and tickets.

  • Data Ingestion: Developed a simple mobile-friendly web interface allowing employees to upload photographs of documents directly from their phones.
  • Intelligent Document Processing: Architected a data extraction pipeline using an ensemble of OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engines and LMMs (large multimodal models) to maximize accuracy. This included a fallback system to flag ambiguous data for human verification.
  • Automated Validation: Reverse-engineered the national tax authority’s (SUNAT) web portal to build a service that automatically validated every digitalized invoice against the official government database.
  • Data Storage: Wrote the validated, structured data into a clean database for the client’s use.

Key Outcome: The system successfully processed the documents with an extremely low error rate, protecting the company from government fines.

item.title: Thanks
item.description:
Isn’t it incredible how someone you might never have the chance of seeing in person can change your life in such fundamental ways?

I’m not at all the most optimistic person with the current state of the world, where the advent of the internet created a state of generalized emotional numbness and mindless consumerism. Still, the internet is such a marvelous thing, It has allowed many people to spread their knowledge, teachings and creations to the world.

About me #

  • I’m a guy in my early 20s from Lima, Perú.

  • Since I was little, I’ve been drawn to science and engineering.

  • The public school system here is not very demanding, so after finishing high school I felt lost and began to self-study math, coding, and physics (shoutout to these wonderful people).

  • I learned to speak English by watching YouTube videos and scrolling through Reddit.

  • I studied 3 semesters of electrical engineering at a local private university, but I dropped out due to financial difficulties and general disappointment with the state of education.
